title: Ticket #3880: RFE: Cooperative Scheduling
description:
Awhile back, an OSG Blueprint discussion about cooperative scheduling between glideinWMS and the site batch system evolved into an HTCondor design document. See attached.

Work on this is not currently active (I'm following up with some related-but-distinct ideas elsewhere), but I wanted to record the design for historical purposes.

Some juicy nuggets within the document:

  • A new condor_chirp verb so the pilot can inform the schedd about the last job commit and the next expected job commit (the site negotiator can rank preemptions accordingly).
  • A condor_rooster-like mechanism for the negotiator to warn jobs when they are in danger of being preempted (the pilot could then avoid starting new jobs).
  • A new condor_chirp verb so the pilot can query whether the site starter is in DRAIN state (so no new jobs are started while the slot is draining).
